items.title: Time is running out to score hundreds in FREE credit on Google’s new Pixel 10 and 10 Pro/XL
items.summary:
Google unleashed all of its next-generation gear last month, and there is now less than 48 hours left to take advantage of the deals. While it wouldn’t be surprising to see retailers like Amazon keep their hundreds in bonus credit offers rolling, the official Google Store does say its Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro XL promotion “ends 9/4” and that means the clock might be ticking to take advantage here.

items.title: Logitech Woot sale is back at up to 67% off! Mac and gaming accessories from just $9
items.summary:
Woot is back with another sale, offering a wide range of Logitech peripherals, accessories, and more at some of their best prices ever. This sale event covers everything from Mac and iPad accessories to gaming peripherals, with deals starting at just $9. Most items are brand new, but you’ll also find open-box steals delivering deeper discounts like Logitech’s regularly $100 MX Keys Mini Wireless Keyboard down at $62.99 Prime shipped. What makes this sale even better is that you can use code LOGITECHFIVE at checkout for an extra $5 off for a limited time. Continue reading to get all the details.

more…

Most of the time, a measuring tape works just fine for smaller projects. But when tackling something bigger, a powerful unit is bound to come in handy. It boasts two lasers, with one that shoots out each direction to independently capture roughly 196 feet from either end. items.summary:
Belkin’s new Qi2.2 25W MagSafe stands are already up for purchase ahead of iPhone 17, and it is likely only a matter of time before it updates its MagSafe car charger with more power too. But it’s likely going to cost you whole lot more than the $39.99 shipped sale price for the current 15W model we are tracking on Amazon right now. Question is whether or not the extra 10W of juice is worth paying what will almost certainly be close to double the price for the new Belkin one, or just paying the same $40 for the new UGREEN 25W model.

While a lot of options go with boring gray or black styles, this one really pops if you ask me. Inside you’ll find room for Nintendo’s latest console, 8 cartridges, and more. items.title: OpenAI to route sensitive conversations to GPT-5, introduce parental controls

items.title: Heybike’s End of Summer Sale offers Mars 2.0 folding e-bike extra battery bundle back at a $1,199 low, more
items.summary:
Heybike has switched over to its End of Summer Sale event that is seeing up to $649 in savings across a condensed e-bike list, with many of them also receiving free bundled gear too. Among the offers, we’re seeing a second-time chance at Heybike’s Mars 2.0 Folding Fat-Tire e-bike coming with an extra battery for double the mileage at $1,199 shipped, with the option to forgo the bundle and get the standard e-bike’s package with a front and rear basket starting from $999 shipped. Normally, this twice-offered bundle with the battery would cost $1,848 without any savings, which we first saw pop up two weeks ago in the early days of the brand’s Labor Day Sale. It’s coming back around here, likely in an ongoing response to the release of the new upgraded Mars 3.0 e-bike, giving you $649 in total savings at the lowest price we have tracked. Head below for more on this model and the others seeing discounts in this sale.

more…
